Campus

AICTE

ABOUT NISP

The Ministry of Education (MoE), Govt. of India has established MoE’s Innovation Cell (MIC) to systematically nurture the culture of Innovation among all Higher Education Institutions (HEIs). The ‘National Innovation and Startup Policy (NISP) 2019 for students and faculty in Higher Education Institutions (HEIs) was launched by former Minister of Education, Shri Ramesh Pokhriyal ‘Nishank’ on 11th September 2019 at AICTE, New Delhi..

The policy aims to assist higher education institutions in developing, streamlining, and strengthening their innovation and entrepreneurial ecosystems on campus. It will be critical in maximizing the potential of students’ creative problem-solving and entrepreneurial mindsets, as well as fostering strong intra and interinstitutional partnerships with ecosystem enablers and various stakeholders at the regional, national, and international levels.

MIC has envisioned encouraging creation of the Institution’s Innovation Council (IICs) across HEIs. A network of IICs is formed to foster innovation and entrepreneurship in the institution through a variety of techniques, resulting in a campus-wide innovation ecosystem. MIC has established the Institution’s Innovation Council in more than 2500 Institutions till December 2021.

CMRIT’S IIC

To meet the MIC’s initiative to establish the Institution’s Innovation Council at Higher Education Institutions (HEI’s) CMR Institute of Bangalore’s IIC (Institution’s Innovation Council) cell has been established in 2018 and NISP policy has been implemented in the year 2019. CMR Institute of Technology Bangalore has initiated the efforts for implementing the National innovation and start-up policy (NISP) under the aegis of the Ministry of Education’s Innovation Cell (MIC). The policy aims at promoting innovation and start-up culture among the students and faculty of the Institute

NISP@CMRIT

Vision

“To be an innovation and entrepreneurship ecosystem to generate globally competitive and sustainable startups.”

Mission

  • Establish professional networks to support various aspects of innovation and entrepreneurship.
  • Create necessary infrastructure to prototype ideas and to incubate startups.
  • Develop startup competencies by regular training, competitions, and other related activities.
  • Establish processes which guide and validate the conversion of business ideas into sustainable startups.
  • Participate on national and global platforms to understand the competitive landscape.
